alert.note: Alert for Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 10 at 5:56PM EDT until July 10 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN WORCESTER COUNTY... At 556 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Flooding was reported at 4:43 PM 2 NNW of Rutland, MA on Route 56 at Vista Circle. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Worcester, Marlborough, Shrewsbury, Westborough, Grafton, Holden, Auburn, Hopkinton, Northborough, Oxford, Millbury, Charlton, Leicester, Sutton, Rutland, West Boylston, Upton, Paxton, Boylston and Berlin. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
